definition: to take precedence
variant of 占[zhan4]
to observe/to divine
to take possession of/to occupy/to take up
early/prior/former/in advance/first

sentences.english: Jack stole a match on Bill, and got the job by getting up earlier.
sentences.chinese: 杰克悄悄占先一步，比比尔早起而抡到了这份工作。

sentences.english: For example, a survey may show that a candidate is doing well in an election.
sentences.chinese: 举例说，调查显示某君在选举中形势占先。

sentences.english: Our team led all the others in the contest.

definition: middle game (in go or chess)
to pull back/to regain (one's dignity etc)/to recover from (an adverse situation)/to turn the tables
dominant/controlling/strong/opposite: weak, yielding 弱受/to take by storm (military)
to gain the upper hand by a show of strength
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to take the lead/to gain the upper hand
to dominate/dominant
lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
to catch up vigorously/to set off in hot pursuit
key moment/decisive opportunity
to go smoothly/to come off/to succeed
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
to win as a result of tenacious effort/to fight off tough competition
score
to come first/previous/prior/beforehand/first/formerly
initiative (as in "seize the initiative")/advantageous position that allows one to call the shots
